Customizing titles associated with R plots is one way in which you can play around with what your aesthetics looks like. The type argument specifies the visual style of the plot.

fib = c(1,1,3,5,8,13)

plot(fib,     main = "Fibonacci Series",     sub = "First 6 Digits",     xlab = "index",     ylab = "value",     font.main = 3,     cex.main = 5,     font.axis = 2,     col.lab = "blue",     type = "b",     pch = 10,     lty = 5,     col = "blue",     cex = 4,     lwd = 6,     las = 1)
